response_template: Shipping is structured into our pricing model. The landed cost is what matters — and on these brands, the math works. Happy to walk through the numbers on a quick call.
We can discuss a trial structure on the call. Most partners start focused and scale from there.
We structure initial orders around proven sellers in your category. The brands we'd recommend have strong sell-through data. Happy to walk through the specifics.
Of course. Happy to include them on the call — sometimes it's easier to evaluate together. I can send a calendar invite for all parties.
Good — then you know the demand. The question is whether you're getting the best sourcing terms on them. That's worth a 30-minute comparison.
Understood. We're not adding complexity — we consolidate sourcing across multiple brands through one relationship. That's the value.
The brands we source at significant discounts off retail actually improve cash position — your per-unit cost drops significantly. Worth looking at the numbers together.
That's actually ideal timing to evaluate sourcing before your next buying cycle ramps up. Easier to plan when you're not in the thick of it.
Valid concern. Our sourcing is structured and we can walk through the supply chain details on a call. It's the first thing serious partners want to verify.
Most of our e-commerce partners see strong margins on these brands. The online channel is actually where the velocity is highest.
We work across all sizes. Some of our best partners started with a focused initial order and scaled. It's about the category fit, not the volume.
Happy to share specifics — the most efficient way is a quick 30-minute walkthrough where I can tailor the information to your business. More useful than a generic PDF.
Makes sense. Most of our partners had existing suppliers too — they use us for the brands and pricing their current distributors can't match. Quick comparison is usually eye-opening.
Our sourcing is designed to deliver the best landed cost. Rather than compare list prices, let's look at the actual unit economics on a call — that's where the difference shows.
Totally understand. Would it make sense to book a 30-minute slot for next week? That way we can evaluate when you have a clear window.
